title: Ricki-Lee performs at Telethon as event raises remarkable $42million for children in need
text:
It's one of the biggest fundraising events in Australia.

And on Sunday, Ricki-Lee Coulter, 33, gave a showstopping vocal performance at the Channel Seven's annual Telethon fundraiser in Perth.

The weekend-long event attracted an avalanche of high-flying celebrities and politicians, and managed to raise a staggering $42million for children in need.

Give it to them! Ricki-Lee Coulter delivered an emotional performance at Channel Seven's Telethon fundraiser on Sunday

The 33-year-old beauty, who plays host on Seven's Australia's Got Talent, performed at the charity event with fellow Australian Idol alum, Guy Sebastian.

Ricki looked every inch the superstar on stage, with her long brunette tresses styled in a glamorous loose curl and worn out over her shoulders.

She wore an off the shoulder black sequin embellished dress, and opted for a subtle makeup palette for the occasion, adding a touch of drama with a smokey eye.

Can't touch it: The vocal powerhouse delivered a commanding performance at the event, with her pitch-perfect vocals met with a rousing applause from the audience

Moved: Ricki looked to be genuinely moved by the sheer generosity on display, as news broke that the state raised a remarkable $42.5million during her performance

The brunette beauty delivered a commanding performance, with her pitch-perfect vocals met with a rousing applause from the audience.

And Ricki looked to be genuinely moved by the generosity on display, as news broke that the state had raised a remarkable $42.5million during her performance.

The figure is a new record for the event, smashing last years earnings of $38million.

A Star is Born: The 33-year-old beauty, who plays host on Seven's Australia's Got Talent performed at the charity event with fellow Australian Idol alum Guy Sebastian

Show us the money: Familiar faces that joined Ricki-Lee on the panel included (L) Sunrise host David Koche and (R) The Voice coach Guy Sebastian

Record breaking: The Channel Seven Telethon raised a remarkable $42.5million, becoming the highest fundraising Telethon (per capita) in the world

Earlier in the day, Perth's Convention and Exhibition Centre was a hive of activity as a slew of famous faces encouraged viewers at home watching to donate to the cause.

Familiar names on the panel included Seven chairman Kerry Strokes, actor Joel Jackson, comedian Andrew Denton and Sunrise host David Koche.

The iconic fundraiser has raised close to $350million since it's inception in 1968, with all proceeds going to support the medical and social welfare of children.
